properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential for heavy snow Monday morning into Monday evening. A powerful storm system will move into the Gulf of Alaska tonight. Strong southerly winds in advance of this system will begin to push precipitation over the St. Elias mountains and through the Chilkat Pass Monday morning. We are expecting wet snow mixed with rain. However, heavy precipitation could keep valley temperatures near the freezing mark, allowing snow to accumulate. At this time a great deal of uncertainty exists in how much warm air will invade the Shakwak Valley and how heavily it will precipitate. If a colder regime presents itself, snowfall accumulations in excess of 10 cm are possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-18T15:02:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-17T23:03:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2463606783.2021
Area: Haines Junction
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. A strong low pressure system tracking toward Foxe Basin today will bring strong winds, snow and blowing snow to Naujaat. Strong northerly winds with gusts to 70 km/h along with snow and blowing snow will create a blizzard beginning overnight Monday toward Tuesday morning and last until late evening on Tuesday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T01:40:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-18T09:41:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3426605970.2021
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Northerly winds will reach up to 90 km/h beginning this afternoon. They will diminish gradually overnight. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-19T01:21:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-18T09:22:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2800214847.2021
Area: Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake, Kangirsuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A snowstorm is still prevailing and will end overnight tonight. Total snowfall amounts of 30 to 50 cm are expected. Strong winds will cause local blowing snow. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-18T13:01:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-17T21:02:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3696368218.2021
Area: Chandler area, New Carlisle - Port-Daniel area, Forillon National Park - Gaspé area, Percé area, Baie-Trinité area, Sept-Îles - Port-Cartier area

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. The snow will end during the evening or overnight. Strong winds will give local blowing snow. Total snowfall amounts of 20 to 30 centimetres are expected. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Additional 5 to 10 cm of snow expected today. Locations: Nain and Vicinity Time span: continuing until near noon today. Remarks: Blowing snow is expected to be minimal as temperatures stay near the freezing mark. Conditions will improve quickly near noon. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-18T16:59:28-00:00

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring over some areas. Visibility will begin to improve early tomorrow morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are expected beginning today through Tuesday morning. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A deep low pressure system over the Gulf of Alaska will approach the region on Monday. As a result, heavy snow and strong winds will develop over the Haines Road and South Klondike Highway Monday morning. The storm will rage through the day and into the night. The snow and winds will eventually abate early Tuesday morning. ### Road closures are possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-18T17:08:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-18T01:09:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1904695992.2021
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp, South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intense low pressure system is forecast to bring easterly winds of 50 gusting to 70 km/h beginning overnight Monday and continuing Tuesday. These winds will combine with falling snow to give reduced visibilities and likely blizzard conditions. Conditions will improve Tuesday evening as the winds diminish. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
